content.text: Strategic planning and continuous school improvement form the foundation of educational excellence at Eduversal Partner Schools. This section establishes the framework through which Principals lead their schools in setting strategic direction, monitoring progress toward goals, and ensuring sustainable improvement aligned with our mission to deliver world-class Cambridge education while honoring Indonesian values and identity.

content.title: Effective strategic planning enables Principals to:
items: Translate Vision into Action: Convert the school's mission and Schoolwide Learning Outcomes into measurable goals and operational priorities.
Align Stakeholder Efforts: Unite the Yayasan Foundation, Eduversal management team, teaching staff, parents, and students around shared priorities.
Drive Continuous Improvement: Establish systematic cycles of planning, implementation, monitoring, and reflection.
Demonstrate Accountability: Provide transparent evidence of progress to stakeholders.
Optimize Resource Allocation: Make informed decisions about budget, staffing, and facilities based on strategic priorities.
Prepare for Accreditation: Build a culture of evidence-based reflection and documentation required for CIS/WASC accreditation.

content.text: Every Eduversal Partner School maintains a comprehensive 3-5 year Strategic Plan that articulates the school's vision for development and establishes the roadmap for achieving its mission.

steps.title: Environmental Scanning
steps.desc: Analyze internal and external factors influencing the school through SWOT analysis and data review.

steps.title: Vision Refinement
steps.desc: Revisit the school's mission and vision statements with the Yayasan Board.

steps.title: Strategic Priorities Identification
steps.desc: Identify 4-6 major strategic priorities for the planning period.

steps.title: Stakeholder Consultation
steps.desc: Gather feedback on draft priorities from the Yayasan Board and parent representatives.

steps.title: Goal Setting and Success Metrics
steps.desc: Define specific, measurable goals for each strategic priority.

steps.title: Resource Mapping
steps.desc: Project the financial, human, and physical resources required to achieve each strategic priority.

steps.title: Approval and Communication
steps.desc: Present the complete Strategic Plan to the Yayasan Board for formal approval.

content.title: Required Components of Multi-Year Strategic Plan
rows: Overview of vision, strategic priorities, and expected outcomes.
Environmental scan including enrollment trends and academic performance data.
Detailed plans for each priority including rationale, goals, initiatives, and timelines.
How strategic priorities will be translated into annual School Improvement Plans.
Multi-year budget implications and sustainability indicators.
Supporting data tables and stakeholder consultation summaries.

content.text: KPIs are used to measure the health and performance of the school.

content.title: Standard Network KPIs
items: Academic: EASE scores, Cambridge exam results, University placement rates.
Operational: Student enrollment, Staff retention, Budget adherence.
Stakeholder: Parent satisfaction (NPS), Student wellbeing surveys.
